project.name: Hera QA Platform
project.scope: Unified test orchestration, flaky test analytics

sections.title: Project Context and Role Definition
sections.goal: Establish the candidate's understanding of Hera QA Platform scope and their role in managing it.
sample_questions: Can you walk me through the main objectives of the Hera QA Platform and how they align with Novereon’s mission?
What was your specific scope of responsibility in the Build phase for Hera?
How did you ensure alignment between QA and other departments during early planning?

sections.title: Stakeholder Management and Communication
sections.goal: Evaluate ability to manage cross-functional stakeholders and ensure traceability of QA requirements.
sample_questions: Describe the key stakeholders for Hera and your approach to managing their expectations.
How did you integrate feedback from the Architecture and SRE teams into the QA strategy?
What mechanisms did you use to communicate risk-based testing priorities to non-technical stakeholders?

sections.title: Risk-Based Testing Strategy
sections.goal: Assess depth of knowledge in POL-QA-014 and linking QA strategy to project risk profile.
sample_questions: How did you apply POL-QA-014 in the context of Hera’s flaky test analytics?
Can you give an example where you adjusted test coverage based on changing risk assessments?
What criteria did you use to prioritize high-risk features for early testing?

sections.title: Integration with Other Projects
sections.goal: Understand ability to handle dependencies and integrations with other Novereon platforms.
sample_questions: Were there dependencies on the Nimbus Observability or Helios Datalake projects? How did you manage them?
How did you ensure that test orchestration metrics were compatible with the SLO definitions from other teams?
Describe a situation where a change in another project’s RFC required adjustments to Hera’s QA plan.

sections.title: Decision Making and Tradeoffs
sections.goal: Probe for examples of tradeoff decisions and risk mitigation with evidence from project artifacts.
sample_questions: Describe a tradeoff you made between test execution time and coverage. What evidence supported your choice?
How did you decide when to accept a flaky test versus when to fix it immediately?
Can you walk me through a runbook or RFC you referenced to support a QA-related decision?

sections.title: Retrospective and Continuous Improvement
sections.goal: Identify ability to reflect on project outcomes and improve processes.
sample_questions: Looking back, what would you change in Hera’s QA approach to improve efficiency?
How did you capture lessons learned and feed them back into QA runbooks or RFCs?
What metrics do you believe were most indicative of Hera’s QA success?
